body.name: HOME: A Ham Novel (HAM Action Thrillers Book 4)
body.description: Never did I imagine her triggering the self-destruct. The absolute last resort, for when things were so bad there was no choice but to wipe it all away. A means of escape made possible by obliterating all that was forty years in the making.Destruction that is complete and total, all but a basic outline of the two main structures reduced to rubble. Charred debris flung outward in a wide arc.A dark smudge of black and gray against a pristine white background.APPLESAUCE. One word. Ten letters. All capitals.This safe word was drilled into Ham time and again as she was growing up. A phrase meant to let her and the numerous other girls passing through the refuge know danger was near. One of the various forms of evil they were all hiding from had somehow found them tucked deep in the Idaho wilderness.A simple term Ham never once heard put to use during her formative years there, the numerous precautions taken to keep them safe more than sufficient. Defenses that have now somehow fallen short, meaning that when the single word arrives in her texts from an unknown number late one night, there is no doubting the sender or the unspoken meaning behind it.She needed to get to Idaho. Now.Just minutes removed from her most recent assignment, Ham begins her trek north. A mad dash through the night where she arrives to find the only home she’s ever known destroyed. The closest thing to family she has left forced to go on the run.It’s the beginning of a sprint far more intense than anything she’s ever encountered. A race to find her surrogate relations and keep them safe while unraveling the various forces and motivations acting against them.A list of possibilities that goes back decades, with reach and resources far greater than anything Ham could have imagined... Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: All4 books so far have kept me on the edge of my seat!!! I have NO doubt that book5 will be just as fantastic!! Please keep Ham going!! I just can't get enough of her!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Is where the heart is.
reviews.reviewText: Ham is an interesting and powerful friend or enemy to be in contact with. The former the best position to be in. She is highly trained and the epitome of either position. I will read more of her stories . I'm moving on to the next one in this series. I really like this author. Thanks for all the entertainment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The story of Ham continues in Book #4. A story of her past and new fighting for her once home. She takes on the army that tries to destroy the only home she ever had.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Home is the fourth book in a Series by ary with an organization that only causes harm to unscrupulous people who the world is better off without.Home finds Ham going after the people who are putting her sister, niece, the woman who raised her and a few other defenseless young girls in danger. All due to the fact that an extremely wealthy man has hired a group to kidnap his daughter living in the Home.As usual, Dustin has written this book to grab your attention from beginning to end!I recommend this book and the entire series. Start with book one if you want to enjoy the escapades of Ham from the beginning and you won't be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally! We find out!
reviews.reviewText: This book is about loss, but also about resilience. Hamis called home to rescue her extended family after a group of bad people who tried to end tje pm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2022
reviews.reviewText: A good story, and one that reiterates why you don't want to cross Ham. A bit too descriptive for me, makes for tedious reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the wait!
reviews.reviewText: This 4th book is easily the best. The previous were terrific as well, but this book ties together the main characters from the previous 3 in such wonderful fashion. The story was crafted in such a way to bring previous back story history into the book without diluting it. And allowing us to see the skill sets that each character brings to the adventure!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not my favorite!
reviews.reviewText: I had trouble following this story. I was just about halfway through and finally figured out what was happening. Too many dead people for me......not my cup of tea.
You like action? Don't miss this one. Hoping for another soon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Did not want to put down
reviews.reviewText: Very busy and fit a lot in
